comments.content: It's a clearly stated policy. Posted around venues, shouted by security, played on the video screens before the show. The policy has been there since the 90s Get over it.

I just saw them on Sunday in CT and initially questioned the policy myself. Until the show started. And I‚Äôll tell you what, I didn‚Äôt miss seeing hundreds of screens all over the arena. It‚Äôs a great policy, and I appreciate what Maynard is doing.
Grandpa doesn't like the capture rectangle.
In my mind at least, rock and roll always has been about letting people do whatever the fuck they want. Mommy, someone's filming with a phone! Big deal. Get over it.

GOOD...saw  King Crimson  a few years back, afore they came on stage they had an announcement, put across light heartedly, requestin nae phones etc durin the show...not one appeared the entire 2hrs! it wus bliss!

Been to tons of concerts, both pre mobile phones and after.  I never see a difference and if you are letting people holding a phone ruin your time at a show, then I think you got some more issues that need to be tended to.

I agree that recording during a concert takes away from experiencing the show, but if those people paid to see the show they shouldn‚Äôt get kicked out for recording, it‚Äôs their experience to waste. How are they able to kick people out? I wonder if this falls under a venue rule or an agreement when you bought the ticket?

It made a huge difference at their show on Camden last night. Not a glowing screen in sight, and a good time was had by all during an amazing performance. Still though, I somehow doubt it was 60 people, if any at all were even thrown out. Maynard is pa ... See More
I'm with Maynard. Live in the moment and enjoy the ride. Maybe it's just me but I never thought I had the right to block other fans view of the stage with my fucking hand held computer.

I don't like the use of phones, but wouldn't throw people out for using them. I'd think a polite request is enough. Maynard James Keenan sounds like a control freak and forgot that these people paid money to see APC play live.
Good. I saw Tool a few years ago and the policy was in place then and made me wish more artists and venues would implement it.
IÔ∏è miss the days when there weren‚Äôt cell phones at shows. It really does take away from the experience from the people around you trying to enjoy the show.
I always love it when some asshole behind me records the show with the flash on. Makes it that much more enjoyable.  üôÑ

Wow, so many people crabbing about other people using phones at concerts. It's easy to ignore if the concerts good enough your eyes should be on the stage. I'd hate to spend the kind of money to see someone who'd pull this drama. I'd rather see acts that embrace it and sometimes even post photos or some video of what their fans capture.
Taking a few photos shouldn't be an issue, but holding your phone up the whole time like a lighter, as if you'll get better video than the guys being paid to film, is bullshit.
NOTHING I love more than going to a concert and watching it through 14 different people phones...  The drunk FUCKTARD that leaves the flash on I'd the BEST...

I saw a Tool show last spring and it was posted everywhere and I received at least 3 emails regarding the policy leading up to the show. Needless to say I was very careful when I chose to pull out my phone.

he stopped a show at back in like "02 cause people had their phones out. i get it and i don't. people should be respectful, but the show was basically ruined cause he was so pissed and they ended early.

I love Tool and A Perfect Circle but I can't stand this douche nozzle. Quit worrying about phones in the hands of people that paid to see your whiney ass, and get the damn Tool album done! Also, try switching up the song list at your shows. I saw the same exact show twice last year.

I went to see tool/primus in Pensacola last year and APC in Tennessee a few weeks ago. I got a pic at both shows...just one. To remind myself....to show my grand babies years down the road when they need a reminder of what real music...real talent is.  ... See More

Don't understand why people are getting pissy about getting kicked out lol. They're the ones that can't follow or respect simple rules.. Personally i hate seeing phone screens in the air the whole time..

I wish they could have a No talking in the crowd policy too. Had to listen to two people who just met yell to each other about where they lived and what they did for work during one of APC's beautiful quiet songs... Argh
I wish more artists were doing this at their shows. That's the one thing I hate more than crowd surfers, assholes and their phones. Kudos Maynard!

Saw Tool and APC both this year.  Signs everywhere stating this at both shows.   Sidenote: why is he always hiding in the back?  I didn't even k of he was on stage until halfway through the Tool show!

I tour as a lighting tech, and I completely understand artists' hatred for cellphones. Looking out into the crowd from backstage, it's frustrating and disheartening. You can't see anyone's eyes. It creates a real disconnect between the artist and the audience...and that affects the energy of the performance.

so last night  LCD Soundsystem  played and I was surprised that I only saw about 3 cams up and recording some of their songs.  I was purdy happy with that cause I HATE when people raise both arms to fucking record or take pics... Dont get me wrong, Its hard not to... Now I keep my phone in my pocket...and enjoy the show

I'm a regular concert-goer. The most obnoxious thing to me, as a person barely over 5 feet tall, is when a bunch of people obscure the show with their phones. You recording quality is shit, so why even bother? Unplug and enjoy.
Amanda Gilliam   couldn‚Äôt have been happier that IÔ∏è not once pulled my phone out during the Tool concert. Hard to enjoy a show when you‚Äôre watching it on your phone.

you know what ruins a show for me? drunken idiots. people having conversations they could have later. the assholes that have to yell during intimate moments. idgaf about people taking photos...unless the flash is on.
I got kicked out the last song for audio recording lol I wasn't even holding it up or anything, it was just in my lap ü§£ ü§£ ü§£ ü§£
I agree it is annoying as hell...but he comes across like such an old fart by doing this. It's one thing to say it and believe it, but kicking out paying fans....fuck this

I went to 2 shows last weekend.  The first had a lot of ‚Äúmillennials at it and all I could see are fucking phones recording. It‚Äôs fucking horrible because it takes away from others enjoyment. Might as well open a fucking umbrella and stand in the crowd ... See More

I love the various projects Maynard's been involved in throughout the years, but, the dude is a pretentious, control freak asshole, and not just about live recordings at his shows. However, I saw APC play in Portland back in 2011, as part of a one-off ... See More

Anyone who has been to any MJK shows should know not to use your phone. I almost got kicked out of a tool show in 2006 and haven‚Äôt used one at tool related show since. It also made me realize that watching a show through your phone when you‚Äôre there is a stupid waste of money. It never captures the real feel of the show anyways. I pretty much try to not have my phone out at all at any show nowadays.
I honestly wish more bands would do this. Would be great if they even just enforced a ‚Äúfirst three songs‚Äù rule like they do for press.

I can‚Äôt express how much I love this. I was at a Jay Z concert the other night and the woman sitting next to me snap chatted at least 80% of the show (no exaggeration). The last thing we want to see is the phone of the person standing in front of us all night. I wish this was policy was used by more artists and venues.

I don't think there's anything wrong with taking a photo or two for the sake of memorabilia, but don't do it the whole time and for fucks sake, keep your flash off, and your brightness down. Don't ruin the show for yourself and others. Leave the recording for the professionals

Went to their show at  EagleBank Arena  in VA a couple weeks ago and it was awful! Men running around with machine guns bullying those taking a photo w/ cell phones. Terrifying and horribly managed!! Took 8+ cops to strong arm one girl into a back room, she was in tears. All over a photo! Did not feel safe!!

THIS! Get your pictures in the first 3 songs (if you must) then put it away and rock the EFF out! There is pro photos and video at almost every show or tour lately and no one wants to watch a show from behind your cell phone or on YouTube on a shitty cell phone recording.

When Axel Rose did it, he was an asshole. When Maynard did it, "he gets it". Fuck Maynard. He's not some untouchable god. If people want to snap a few photos at a show they paid for, they have that right to do so. Maynard seems to forget why he's makin ... See More

So a phone goes off in a movie theater and everyone fucking looses it, but when you can see everyone's phone an entire $80 concert it's totally cool, gotcha gotcha.  I guess most people really aren't there for the show anyway, just a notch in their "I did a cool thing" belt.

Good! Nothing ruins a great concert experience like a congregation of the self absorbed in one‚Äôs immediate vicinity.  Because, as we all know, nothing  makes a concert more awesome than being forced to watch a the show through the raised phone of the ignorant asshole standing in front of you.

What a dick....ive been telling people this guy is a tool (see what i did there) for years and hes proved it.  Some people live mundane lives and like to preserve the rare occasion they get to do cool shit you haughty asshole.

This easy to fix, went to chris brown gig recently and they locked everyone's phones away giving people a little case that couldnt be opened unless with a key. Kicking people out its a bit much, gotta respect those who pay to be at your gigs, policy or not. Unfortunately people are addicted to their mobile phones but thats the way the world is now I suppose

I've seen Prince and  Bosnian Rainbows  and they had the same policy.  I love seeing a show with no phones in the air, just hands.  Bosnian Rainbows did say that you could use your phone for the first 3 songs, then no more which I thought was a good compromise.

I get it and appreciate a "screen in font of you free" concert experience but kicking out people from your show? We have to deal with the reality that everyone has a camera in their pocket and bands should adapt to that and succumb to the reality it implies.

IÔ∏è met Maynard almost 10 years ago when he was promoting his wine, and he was a total dick then as well. Kicking people out for even mentioning Tool or APC when they went to get their bottle of wine signed by him. Dude needs a reality check.
As soon as the show is free he can dictate how I enjoy it. Until then, F him. He is strong arming his fans with a ‚Äúmy way or no concert‚Äù. He is literally nothing without them.
Can we talk about the fact that Maynard is using an Instagram filter that hasn't been available for somewhere around five years.
Good. All of the damn cellphones at concerts are annoying and distracting, disrespectful both to the artist and your fellow concert goers.
